title: I need font ID. Thanx in advance.
author: azovko7

comments.content:
It is easier if it’s smaller

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021442im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ID%20font_3986.jpg)

I think it’s [Futura Demibold](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021442/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/neufville/futura-nd/demibold/) that has been tightly spaced. Starting at the demibold weight, the normal Futura pointed apex of A, M and N is flattened.

- Mike Yanega
Thank you a lot, Mike. Indeed it is Futura Demibold. I found this in very old issue of magazine Print. I like it a lot. Thanx again.
